concept.title: Bundlemaker Core
concept.shortdesc: The Bundlemaker core bundle defines the core concepts and abstractions that are used to analyse, transform and re-export a java application. It provides an API and several extension points [TBD] that can be used to defined arbitrary parsers, transformers or exporters.

section.title: Overview
section.p: To analyse and transform a java-based system you first have to create a Bundlemaker project Bundlemaker project. A Bundlemaker project contains a project description Bundlemaker project description that defines the content of the application that should be analysed. Unlike many other dependency analysis tools Bundlemaker is able to parse byte code as well as java source code. So the project description can contain binary content (e.g. JAR archives) and source content (e.g. ZIP files that contain java source files).
Before an application can be transformed and re-exported in a new structure, it has to be parsed.
